text: [Music]
hi this is Seema and I am back with a
new lesson on idioms on health well we
all want to be in the pink of health
don't we well health is wealth as they
say and I know all of you yearn to be in
good health and therefore these idioms
will help you relate to your health and
see if you can you know apply it in your
day-to-day life well let's go on to the
first one which is in bad shape well
this is something that you and I none of
us want to be in what is being in bad
shape being in bad shape is nothing but
being in poor physical condition so you
know it could mean that someone is
really not fit because he or she is not
exercising and therefore he you know he
or she can't walk too much he gets tired
very fast in on the other hand in bad
shape could also refer to someone who is
really ill because of a particular
illness so in match shape is you know
being unfit being not able to do a lot
of physical activities because you know
your physical body is not getting a lot
of workout so in bad shape is something
we've all got to fight maybe even I need
to do that to a certain extent
moving on to back on your feet well
let's look at what back on your feet
literally means imagine me I was
sleeping for some time and now I have
stood up and I am back in my feet so
when I pipe that to my health what do I
mean I mean that I have recovered or it
is a recovering from
an illness or maybe an accident so I
could say that you know I am back in my
fate or I have recovered from an illness
after maybe six months or my friend was
back on his feet after a really tragic
accident so back on your feet is now the
ability to kind of go about your normal
routine you know in a proper physical
condition after an unusually long term
of illness or a long term of having you
know being in bed rest bag of bones well
what is bones mean when I hear the word
bones I am thinking about bones skeleton
something very skinny so bag of bones
naturally means someone a person who is
skinny maybe thin very very thin very
weak well I need this friend of mine you
know who used to study at a hotel and
you know prior to studying there he used
to live in his own home and we all know
that when we when we're at home we get a
lot of food to eat we're kind of resting
a lot we're really comfortable but when
we are out of home we're out of our
comfort zone and that's what makes us
lose on weight become thin
become unwell so I had a friend of mine
who was a bag of bones because now he
went on from living at home the
comfortable home to a hostel black out
what does black out mean well switch off
the lights and you'll know what I'm
talking about
well that's what literally a blackout
means but as far as the health is
concerned black out is nothing but
losing consciousness so there are some
people who look at a needle and black
out there are some people who can't see
a lot of blood
when they do they black out so black out
is nothing but losing consciousness just
getting knocked off completely okay well
the next idiom is blind as a bat well
most people believe that bats are blind
well that is scientifically untrue but
this idiom comes from the belief that
bats are blind because they sleep during
the day and they're up wide awake at
night but blind as a bat is an idiom
which is used to talk about someone
whose vision is very poor or someone who
cannot see very properly so well my
grandfather you know he he loved to read
he he read all his life but he was as
blind as a bat without his glasses
without his reading glasses he couldn't
see anything his vision was almost blind
as a bat
moving on to feel blue well blue is a
color which does not really talk about
you know it's a cool color not a warm
color and therefore the word feel blue
talks about feeling sad or it talks
about depression in general so I well I
had a friend of mine you know who was
feeling blue after you know her accident
because after her accident she could not
really move out could not really resume
her normal work activities and therefore
feeling blue is something that relates
to a state of being sad or an extreme
sadness called
depression moving on to off-color well
we all like some color in our lives
don't we so when I talk about being
off-color I'm talking about something
that is not very pleasant
so off-color
is an idiom which refers to someone or
something when I want to say that I am
feeling sick maybe I'm looking sick
well sometimes you look at some people
or in you know in hospitals or who are
at home and not feeling very well and
then you say that they they look
off-color which means they look sick or
if I say that I'm feeling lost color
like I am saying that I am feeling sick
today and we had the last one full of
beans full of beans well beans are a
very healthy you know healthy thing to
have in our day to day meals so full of
beans is nothing but with a person that
we are referring to who is lively who is
happy and who is very very healthy so I
could say that the secret to being full
of beans is living a very healthy
lifestyle so full of beans or I could
say the 70 year old man is still full of
beans because he adopts a healthy
lifestyle well that brings me to the end
of this lesson on idioms on health I
hope it was very useful I hope you've
learned from it and I hope you can apply
it in your day to day life well now that
you know where you stand and you know
now that you know how you can relate to
your own health using this idioms we'll
go through it and apply it you have a
nice day I'll be back with some more
lessons
[Music]
